name: Learningos
tagline: My Notes and Questions from a Book I am auditing
body:
# LearningOs

 What is a extracted from a Boot-Disk?
 Where is the boot-disk? 
>>address of the interrupt handler we're looking for: IDTR * 4
http://wiki.osdev.org/Interrupt_Vector_Table#Structure
??Difference between interrupt descriptor table and interrupt vector table??
>>An ISR is called directly by the CPU, and the protocol for calling an ISR differs from calling e.g. a C function. 
Most importantly, an ISR has to end with the iret opcode, whereas usual C functions end with ret or retf
